Package neqsim.physicalProperties.interfaceProperties.surfaceTension

Class GTSurfaceTensionFullGT

java.lang.Object
neqsim.physicalProperties.interfaceProperties.surfaceTension.GTSurfaceTensionFullGT
public class GTSurfaceTensionFullGT extends Object

GTSurfaceTensionFullGT class. Solving for the surface tension by direct Newton method.
TODO: Make use of binary interaction parameter for the influence parameter \f$\beta_{ij}\f$ when this becomes available in NeqSIM API.

Version:
$Id: $Id
Author:
Olaf Trygve Berglihn olaf.trygve.berglihn@sintef.no, John C. Morud john.c.morud@sintef.no

  • Method Details

    • runcase

      public double runcase()
      Calculation of the interfacial tension.
      Returns:
      Interfacial tension in N/m.

    • Newton

      public static double Newton(double[][] cij, double L, int N_Newton, double allowedRelChange, boolean highOrder, boolean directMethod, double[][] rhomat, SystemInterface sys, int ncomp, double t, double[] mueq)

      Newton. Calculate surface tension by full gradient method and Newtons method The routine solves the Finite Difference equations for the full Gradient Theory by Newtons method. Note that the length coordinate is in nm-units. Method: 1. Calculate delta_mu and its Jacobian 2. Call routine "directsolve" for Newton step 3. Dampen the step if relative step too large 4. Iterate until convergence or max #iterations (N_Newton)

      Parameters:
      cij - an array of type double
      L - a double
      N_Newton - a int
      allowedRelChange - a double
      highOrder - a boolean
      directMethod - a boolean
      rhomat - an array of type double
      sys - a SystemInterface object
      ncomp - a int
      t - a double
      mueq - an array of type double
      Returns:
      sigma The surface tension [N/m]

    • directsolve

      public static void directsolve(double[][] rres, double[][][] JJ, double[][] C, double H, int Ngrid, double[][] rhomat, int ncomp)

      directsolve. Solve linear system for Full Gradient method

      Parameters:
      rres - an array of type double
      JJ - an array of type double
      C - an array of type double
      H - a double
      Ngrid - a int
      rhomat - an array of type double
      ncomp - a int

    • sigmaCalc

      public static double sigmaCalc(double h, double[][] rrho, double[][] C, boolean highOrder, double[][] drhodz, int ncomp)

      sigmaCalc. Calculates the interface tension The following integral is solved with the trapezoidal method: \f{equation}{ \sigma = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \boldsymbol{n_z}^T \boldsymbol{C} \boldsymbol{n_z} \, dz \f}

      Parameters:
      h - a double
      rrho - an array of type double
      C - an array of type double
      highOrder - a boolean
      drhodz - an array of type double
      ncomp - a int
      Returns:
      sigma The surface tension [N/m]

    • calc_std_integral

      public double calc_std_integral(double[] z, double[][] C, double[][] drhodz)

      calc_std_integral. Calculate width of interface region (length scale) Estimate the width of interface by calculating the second moment of the surface tension integrand. Used to adjust the domain size

      Parameters:
      z - an array of type double
      C - an array of type double
      drhodz - an array of type double
      Returns:
      Interface width (length scale) [nm]

    • delta_mu

      public static void delta_mu(SystemInterface sys, int ncomp, double t, double[] mueq, double[] rho, double[] delta_mu, double[][] dmu_drho)

      delta_mu. Calculate \f$\Delta\mu=\mu-\mu_0\f$ and its number density derivative.

      Parameters:

      ncomp - a int
      t - a double
      mueq - an array of type double
      rho - an array of type double
      delta_mu - an array of type double
      dmu_drho - an array of type double
